name: Remnants of a Beautiful Day
description: An artistic narrative designed to evoke a surreal feeling in the player on a psychological level. Platformer-puzzle-advanture with a handful of different endings!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7/8/8.1/10 Processor: 1.5 ghz or better Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Intel (R) HD Graphics Family DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 700 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7/8/8.1/10 Processor: Greater than 1.5 ghz Memory: 6 GB RAM Graphics: Any (including APU built in graphics) DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 1 GB available space Sound Card: Any

reviews.review_text: I got this game from a Dr Wolf steam code.  I have a few thoughts.  Though the graphics weren't amazing, it wasn't really anything to make me dislike the game, though I did spot a few wrong textures.  I spent the first level aimlessly wandering around, getting more and more frustrated until I accidentally fell into the river. It could have been more obvious or maybe that was just me being stupid.  I really enjoyed the parkour element and the music and visuals but I wouldn't play it again.  I would definetly reccomend trying it out. It's fun once you understand and very intriguing.  Overall, I think it's a good game but perhaps not quite my cup of tea.  8 random blob monsters out of 10

What was smoking the developer of this game? Alright, jokes aside. To be honest I like this game. The graphics has seemed to me pretty good, everything is done beautifully. But more of graphics I liked music. The music is very pleasant for the ears. Minuses I did not notice, because was admiring the surroundings. I recommend to the purchase this game. If you are tired by a hard day and want to relax, you must try this game.
